dialogue.string: 1�I am Hyria, the captain of the guard here in Mhaura. My duty is to protect the governor from harm.
1�You can see the whole of the harbor and town from here. I like watching the port especially. There are so many different kinds of people getting on and off the ships there.
1�Hello.I haven't seen you around here beforrre. Are you new in town?
1�Are you new to Mhaura?Yes, it's my first time here.No, I've come here plenty of times.
1�Ah, I thought so. Welcome to Mhaura.You should go to the governor's house. They'll tell you all you need to know about our little town.
1�First, climb the stairs there, and walk along the ledge to another set of stairs. Go up, and you're therrre.
1�You're not pulling my tail, are you? Hmm...I guess I must've just missed you. Still, you look lost.
1�Have you been to the governor's house yet? If not, you should. They'll tell you all you need to know about our little town.
1�I can't let you through this door. This is the guards' barrrracks. No unauthorized people allowed.
1�You can't tell if you're in the town, but I hearrr the beastmen are up to something out there. How are things where you come from?
1�Hello, therrre.I don't believe I've seen you before.You must be new in town.
1�Are you new to Mhaura?Yes, it's my first time here.No, I've come here plenty of times.
1�I thought so. Welcome to Mhaura! Visitors like you should go to the governor's house to get an orientation.
1�Go up the stairs at the western end of this square, then up again the stairrrs on your left. Good luck!
1�Rrreally? I'm sorry. I'm usually good with names...
1�You should visit the governor's house if you haven't already. They will answer any questions you have about Mhaura.
1�This is a small town, but we get a lot of traffic because of the port. We have to stay alert and try to stop trrrouble before it starts.
1�Port guard duty's pretty tough work. Of course, it's best when we don't have anything to do. It means Mhaura's safe.
1�I heard once that old Vera was a warrior of some renown when she was young. It's before my time, of course, so I don't know if it is true.
1�And by her age, I'd say anyone who could testify to the veracity of that rumor would be long gone.
1�Welcome to the Sailorrr's Stay!If you need armor or shields, we got those, too! Just talk to Graine here, and she'll show you our wares!
1�And if you need weapons, go see Runito-Monito upstairrrs! He's got the meanest weapons this side of the Bastore Sea!
1�You may not believe me, but before airships started to fly, this inn was packed all year round.
1�Those days are long past, and this town is a little on the dingy side now, but we Mhaurans haven't changed. Some of us have our quirks, but we all still welcome travelers with open arms.
1�Welcome to the Sailors' Stay.Hm? You're looking for work? Well, I guess we could always use an extra hand...
1�Go talk to our resident cook, Rycharde. He should be around here somewhere.
1�Hi, there. You've been working for Rycharde for a while now...do you know what's wrong with him lately? He looks down.
1�What? He sent you to Valgeir?Let me guess: he refused to recognize Rycharde's talents again, right?
1�Valgeir is Rycharde's father, and one of the best cooks in Vana'diel. He's also a very strict man, especially to his son.
1�He raised Rycharde to be a great cook like him, but there were some things they could never agree on. In the end, Rycharde ended up leaving home.
1�Rycharde has worked hard and become a very good cook. Valgeir really should give him some credit. Don't you agree?
1�But you know what? I wouldn't mind tasting some of Valgeir's cooking someday. I wonder what it's like?
1�You went and brought me some of Valgeir's cooking? Thank you! I'll have Rycharde taste some of it, too.
1�And here, take these. It's the least I can do.
1�Rycharde has worked hard and become a very good cook. Valgeir really should give him some credit. Don't you agree?
1�But you know what? I wouldn't mind tasting some of Valgeir's cooking someday. I wonder what it's like?
1�Thank you for working so hard to help Rycharde. I promise I'll have him taste some of his father's cooking.
1�Rycharde is a good cook. I'm glad to hear you've been working hard to help him. Good luck to you both!
1�Thanks for bringing some of Valgeir's cooking. It was delicious! I think tasting it really helped Rycharde.
1�Have you seen Rycharde lately? He seems changed. He has this look of determination I've never seen before.
1�He must've rediscovered something deep inside...something he had long forgotten. I'm glad for him, and it's all thanks to you.
1�Yes, can I help you?I'm sorry, I personally don't have any work for you to do. Have you talked to Rycharde?
1�It's tough getting enough food to feed everyone these days, with all those monsters prowling the areas near the town.
1�Yeah, I'm Rycharde. Whaddaya want? Miss Take sent you, you say?
1�Lessee... Bring me %????. I need two of them for this recipe I ??cooked up??...Heh-heh, I kill me. So, whaddaya say?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Good! Better hurry up. Time's a-wastin'.
1�Darn.Well, if you ever change your mind, come talk to me again, all right?
1�Ready to get back in the kitchen, eh?So, you gonna do it? I need two %???? for my recipe.
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Good! Better hurry up. Time's a-wastin'.
1�Darn.Well, if you ever change your mind, come talk to me again, all right?
1�How's it going? You're not done yet, huh? Well, you know where to find me. Good luck.
1�Hey, wait a second! This isn't enough!Come back when you have two, okay?
1�Oh, goodie! Thanks!Here's something for your trouble.
1�I've been an apprentice chef for more than three years now, but someday I'll be a first-rate chef!
1�You're training to become a top-notch adventurer yourself, right? Just come to me if you need more work!
1�Hey. Thanks for last time.I know I told you I'd give you more work, but I don't really need anything right now. Sorry.
1�Just the adventurer I was looking for!I have this order to fill, but I'm missing some ingredients.
1�I need  $???? and  $????, and I need them delivered within three days. Whaddaya say?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Thanks! Remember, I need them within three days! Good luck!
1�No go, huh? Too bad, I guess I'll have to ask someone else. Maybe next time, eh?

1�Go and get those things I asked for, quick! You have 
� ?�[hour/hours] left!
1�Do you have them? No? C'mon, hurry up!
1�You got them! They're still fresh, too!Thanks so much! Now I know who to ask when I need something!
1�Ah...thanks, but when I saw you wouldn't make it, I asked someone else. Well, since you did bring them, though, I'll give you some gil for your efforts.
1�Let me tell you something about cooking: a dish is only as good as its ingredients. The fresher they are, the better the food.
1�Just remember that next time, okay?
1�Hey, long time no see.Remember the last order I got? That was from the governor herself, and she really liked the dish I made for her!
1�She liked it so much, she said she wants me to prepare all her meals from now on!
1�I don't want to disappoint her, so I need you to bring me exotic ingredients to practice my cooking skills!
1�I heard they're pretty hard to get, but I'd like to start with  $????. Whaddaya say?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Really? That's great!You can take your time with it, just as long as you bring me one. Good luck!
1�Yeah, well, I don't blame you. They're not easy to get. Come back, though, if you change your mind.
1�Wow! You got it!I have to say, I'm really impressed!
1�Here's your well-deserved reward. Come back in two or three days if you can. I still have some work for you.
1�Back so soon, eh? So, do you think you can find  $???? for me?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Really? That's great!You can take your time with it, just as long as you bring me one. Good luck!
1�Yeah, well, I don't blame you. They're not easy to get. Come back, though, if you change your mind.
1�So, how's it going? Working hard or hardly working? Take it slow, though. There's no hurry.
1�There you are!I've managed to make a pretty good dish--if I may say so myself--with the ingredient you brought me last time.
1�I know I've been giving you tough jobs so far, so this time I'm going to give you an easy one.
1�All you have to do is take this dish to a man named Valgeir in Selbina. Whaddaya say?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�All right!Go to the port and board the transit ship to Selbina. Here, I'll pay for your travel fare in advance.
1�Oh, when you get back, tell me what Valgeir's reaction was, okay?
1�What? C'mon, it's just a delivery job! I'll even pay your travel fare! Whaddaya say?
1�So, how was it? Did he say anything?Oh...you haven't gone yet. Remember, the man's name is Valgeir. Now hurry to Selbina!
1�So, how was it?Did he say anything?
1�Tell Rycharde...Exactly what Valgeir said.That Valgeir didn't say anything.
1�He said that!? Damn that old man!Will he never admit that I've become as good as him?
1�Really? No, I can tell from your face he did say something, and it wasn't anything good. Thanks for being considerate, but I'm okay with it.
1�Oh...your reward, right. Here.I don't think I'll have any work for you for a while... Thanks for your help, though.
1�Oh...it's you.Sorry, I don't have any work for you. Give me some time to...recover.
1�Ah, you're back.Ms. Take told me. I want to thank you.
1�As for the old man's cooking...it was incredible. I don't think I would ever be able to make anything like that.
1�But I'm not trying to emulate him. I just want to make him acknowledge my way of cooking, you know? And I need your help to accomplish that.
1�I'd like you to bring me four %????. These, again, are hard to find.
1�No deadline. I'll wait until you bring back four of them.So, whaddaya say?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Great! I knew I could count on you!Good luck!
1�That's all right, I understand. It is pretty hard work.Just don't hesitate to come back if you change your mind.
1�So, you thought it over? You'll go look for the four %???? for me?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Great! I knew I could count on you!Good luck!
1�That's all right, I understand. It is pretty hard work.Just don't hesitate to come back if you change your mind.
1�Wow! Thank you!I knew you wouldn't let me down!
1�Here, take this, you earned it!All right! Now I'll show that old man!
1�Thanks, but...this isn't enough. Could you come back when you find four of them? Good luck!
1�Hi! I was waiting for you to come.Rejoice! My new dish is done, and I have a job for you!
1�I need you to take it to Valgeir again.Whaddaya say, will you do it?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�All right!Go to the port and board the transit ship to Selbina. Here, I'll pay for your travel fare in advance.
1�Oh, when you get back, tell me what Valgeir's reaction was, okay?
1�What? C'mon, it's just a delivery job! I'll even pay your travel fare! Whaddaya say?
1�So, how was it? Did he say anything? Oh...you haven't gone yet. I'm sure this time he'll be surprised, so go quick!
1�Hmm? He sent you back to give this to me? But it's just  $????... What does it mean?
1�Anyway, here, this is your reward.Thanks again.
1�Hi again. Thanks for last time!I finally got what that #???? meant!
1�My old man used to make me practice on them when he was teaching me to cook. I would usually mess it up, and he would yell at me for wasting perfectly good %????.
1�For years, he kept yelling at me for every little mistake I made... So one day I left, promising myself I'd show him I could become a good cook without his help!
1�But you know, when I was a kid, my mom used to make the best #????.
1�She wasn't trained like my old man, and she wasn't even using the best utensils...
1�But Mom's %???? were the best!I loved them!
1�That's what this reminded me of, and I realized I had forgotten the most important thing about cooking.
1�I have to get back to the basics. But I'm glad you came along and helped me see my mistake. Thank you!
1�I have to get back to the basics. But I'm glad you came along and helped me see my mistake. Thank you!
1�Oh, you're the one from the pier...I must apologize about my mother.
1�My father was a sailor...No one has seen him or his ship for over a year. People are saying the pirates got him.
1�My mother has to move on...If only she could be convinced that Father won't be coming back...
1�I'd like to believe that he's still alive somewhere... But we can't go on like this. Not anymore.
1�Can you...that is, if it's not too much to ask... Would you help me convince my mother?
1�Help Celestina?Yes.No.
1�Really?Oh, thank you!
1�There's something that Father told me once that might help us. He said that the #???? he wore was very rare.
1�And I recently met a sailor who said he saw a pirate wearing one!
1�Could you bring me that #????? If it is really Father's...I think Mother and I can finally move on.
1�Please!Take back Father's #???? from that pirate!
1�You... You got it.So the pirates really...
1�I've thought long and hard since we last spoke, and I've decided to stand by Mother's side and believe in Father's return.
1�No, Mother!Listen, I...
1�Mother, please! Listen to me!
1�Even if a pirate had this, it doesn't necessarily mean Father's gone!
1�I'll believe...I'll wait with you. So please, don't close your eyes on reality.
1�We must look at the facts, and still keep faith. Father will return safely. We must believe, together.
1�Father's safe. I know it!He'll be back soon, I'm sure!
1�We'll be fine, thanks to you. Father will be coming back soon, I know it.
1�I'm Ekokoko, the governor of this little town. There isn't much to see, but you're welcome to stay as long as you want.
1�If there is anything you wish to know about Mhaura, ask my aide, Numi Adaligo. She's right over there.
1�Oh, this is wonderful, indeed! I was worried I'd have to hunt and peck for you all down the coast.
1�I, Ekokoko, serve as the governor of our bright town.
1�Truth be told, I was not the one who sought you out. No, that would be Gilgamesh, one of Vana'diel's most renowned pir--er, entrepreneurs.
1�Something about setting sail and finding someone lost at sea? Bah, I never had much of a head for details.
1�What I do know is that your name came up on more than one occasion.
1�He also mentioned something about wanting you to procure some %???? from mandragoras around the Crag of Mea before you meet him.
1�He hopes to use it to create a special herbal remedy for his crew--er, associates.
1�And Mhaura has felt the effects particularly hard--our supply of %???? has been dwindling.
1�I'll call Gilgamesh back to port immediately.
1�In the meantime, rough up some of those mandragoras and come back with three %????.
1�And yes, I am well aware that adventurers often charge a fee for their services, and I will personally see to it that you are properly recompensed.
1�How fabulous that you made it back safe,  !
1�Your return couldn't have been more timely--Gilgamesh's ship has only just docked.
1�Let's get the small matter of the %???? out of the way first. Here you go.
1�A-ahem. One last thing before you go. Please, please breathe no word to the citizens about me abetting a known pirate.

1�They might not all understand that a port town is only looking out for its best interests when it ensures that those less on the...up-and-up remain happy. When push comes to shove, aren't we all just looking out for each other?
1�And while I'm not biting the hand that feeds me, I'd like to inform you that the token I have just offered is highly valued here in Mhaura.
1�Why don't you have a brief chat with Vera here before you leave for Norg?
1�I can only hope that you appreciate its value.
1�Welcome to the governor's house.How may I be of assistance?
1�What do you wish to know?You're searching for adventurers?Tell me about Mhaura.Any shops or guilds in town?Where can I find some work?Nothing for now.
1�As you wish.Mhaura is a port town situated within the boundaries of the Windurstian Federation.
1�The natural basin here was ideal for building a port. In time, people started building their homes in the surrounding cliffs. Thus Mhaura came to be.
1�Geographically, Mhaura is situated in the southern half of the Buburimu Peninsula in Southeastern Mindartia. Windurst City is southwest of here.
1�From the port, you can board one of the transit ships to Selbina, a town in Central Quon.
1�Lately, there are even ships traveling to a city called Al Zahbi in the Near Eastern Empire of Aht Urhgan.
1�As you wish.The Blacksmiths' Guild and Goldsmiths' Guild have their salesrooms on the level below us.
1�Across from them spans a bridge leading to a two-story inn called the Sailors' Stay. The reception desk is on the first floor. The armorer, Graine, is also there.
1�Across the Sailors' Stay, on ground level, is the sea travel agency. Ships bound for Selbina and Al Zahbi dock there.
1�To the west of the agency you'll find an antique shop. I should tell you that the owner, Orlando, has some very peculiar tastes...
1�Further west, down a flight of stairs, is the warehouse.
1�Pikini-Mikini, a dealer in goods, and Tya Padolih, a seller of arcane scrolls, have set up shop there.
1�Have you gone to see Take at the Sailors' Stay yet? She may have something for you.
1�Jobs in Mhaura? Hmm... I believe Lady Take at the Sailors' Stay is the person to talk to about such matters.
1�As you wish.Please come by anytime if there is something you wish to ask about Mhaura.
1�Ah, I was told to expect someone named  . Would that be you?
1�Forgive me for not recognizing you sooner. I had been told to be on the lookout and usher you into the governor's office without delay.
1�The world has been bursting at the seams with odd news these days, and frankly, none of us here can make heads or tails of it all.
1�Come back soon!
1�What do you want? Yes, I'm Orlando the antiquary, but I don't deal with people who can't ride chocobos. That means you. Go away.
1�Ah! You can ride chocobos, I see.I'm Orlando the antiquary. I have a proposal for you, if you're interested.
1�Did you know that some of the Goblins around here hide items in the ground?
1�Find those hiding spots and dig them up with a chocobo. If you're lucky, you might even find something valuable.
1�But most of it will be junk. That's where I come in. Bring the junk to me and I'll buy them off you.
1�I only buy items in bunches of eight, though, so only come if you have enough. Of course, the amount I'll pay depends on what you bring.
1�Good hunting, then!But be careful. There are things worse than Goblins out there!

1�Let's see what you've brought... ?%????, eh? I'll give you 
� gil for them. Come back when you've dug up some more!
1�So, how goes the hunt?Bring me eight of the same items and I'll buy them off you. I'll pay more if their quality is good. Good luck!
1�This isn't enough. I told you, I only buy items in bunches of eight. Come back when you have enough, all right?
1�Hmm? It seems like you can't carry anything else. Come back when you've lightened your load.
1�People call me a ??junk collector,?? but they're just a bunch of ignoramuses. Only connoisseurs like me can appreciate the true value of what I have.
1�I'm bored...Maybe I should move to a city in a country with a little more life. Say, how're things where you come from?
1�Hey, she's back again...Every day, she stands there and waits for her husband to return.
1�Yeah... If it was them, there's no chance in hell he's still alive. Poor woman.
1�Really, we're not slackin' off. Ever since th' airship shippin' routes opened, hasn't been much fer guys like us to do, ya know?
1�Yeah, breaks me 'eart to see 'er. How long's it been since he disappeared, ya think? Word is, pirates got 'im.
1�Hello, did you know?They say that pirates of old hid a great treasure in a room somewhere in the Maze of Shakrami.
1�Pirates in those days were very much different from the ones we have now, but pirates are pirates. They're all scary!
1�Apparently, the pirates disguise their ship to look just like a ferry! You should be careful when you travel by sea between Mhaura and Selbina.
1�I've always wondered...where do pirates live? I mean, they can't always be living on their ship. They must have a base somewhere...
1�The old woman who's always standing in front of the warehouse gives me the heebie-jeebies, but for some reason a lot of people come to see her. I wonder why?
1�Mister Orlando likes to collect the strangest things! He can't blame people if they call him a junk collector!
1�I've seen a lot of tough-looking adventurers come to Mhaura to see Mister Nereus. Are you here to see him, too?
1�Bihoro-Guhoro here says he knows all there is to know about pirates...but apparently he hasn't met any yet. Funny, isn't it?
1�Sir Nereus here is the foremost authority on ceramics, and I came all the way from San d'Oria to become his student, but...Sir Nereus is a hard man to please.
1�As you can see, ceramics is one of Mhaura's main exports. I'm glad I always have work as a longshoreman, but I wish they'd stop making me carry all the heavy ones...
1�Hm?If you're looking for the item seller, he's in that warehouse right over there.
1�Hm?If you're looking for the item seller, he's in that warehouse right over there.
1�Say, did you know?
1�I heard there's a job where you can control monsters and make them do anything you want!
1�I heard there's a job where all you have to do is sing!
1�I heard there's a job with long-rains whippings and trakking and deetection!
1�I heard knights wear the bestest armor-warmor!
1�Wow! That sounds like fun!I wanna do that job-wob!
1�Uh...Liking it and being good at it are two different thing-wings...
1�Long-rains...what?What kind of job is that!?
1�I know! I'm gonna-wanna be a knight someday!
1�When I grow up, I wanna-gonna be a knight and a ranger and a...uh...beesmaster!
1�Didn't you say you were going to do some otherrr job before?
1�...That'll neverrr happen...
1�When I grrrow up, I want to be a bride, and wear the most beautiful wedding dress everrr! But I'm not marrying anyone who wants to become a ??beesmaster??!
1�Oh... Hello.I'm waiting for my husband. He's a sailor. I'll be fine. I'm used to waiting.
1�He will come back. I know it.I'll be fine. I'm used to waiting...
1�What are you talking about, Celestina?Your father will soon be home.
1�He's just late, that's all.His boat's not too far. I know it.
1�What is wrong with that girl? Oh, she's probably just excited to see her father after all this time.
1�He will come back. I know it.I'll be fine. I'm used to waiting...
1�Hello again.Thank you for helping us. Hm? What am I still doing here?
1�It's a funny story, really. The people who work here told me it's just not the same without me around.
1�So I've decided to stand here and pray for the safety of all who make their living out on the sea.
1�May the sea be kind to those who venture out in her realm...
1�Eh? What have we got here? A fledgling adventurer! I have no business with the likes of you!
1�I'm Nereus, the best potter here in town! You must be a seasoned adventurer, are you not?
1�Well, uh...Yes, I am!No, not really.
1�Heh-heh-heh. A confident one! Good, good! You remind me of me when I was young!
1�Heh-heh-heh. Modest, are we? You don't have to be. I may be old, but I'm not blind.
1�I have a task that I can only ask one such as you. Interested?
1�Interested?What is it?I'm too busy.
1�I'm glad you asked.You see, I've been making pottery in this town for as long as I can remember... I'm what they'd call an artisan.
1�I've used clay from nearby areas in my work for many years, but I've been favoring clay from the Gusgen Mines lately.
1�The thing is, though, a bunch of fiends seem to have made those mines their home, and traders haven't been able to get any %???? out of there.
1�It wasn't so hard to get some a few years back... You have to understand, to an artisan like myself, getting that clay is a matter of life and death.
1�So...I need a stalwart adventurer like you to bring me  $????. I've heard you can find it deep within the mines.
1�Just make sure to get a map so you don't get lost in there. Good luck!
1�You're too busy, eh? Well, then...come back when you have time.
1�Ah, you've come back!I need another #????. Can you go get some for me?
1�Accept this request?Yes.No.
1�Very good!Remember, it's in those mines I told you about before. Be careful, eh?
1�You're too busy, eh? Well, then...come back when you have time.
1�Oho! Well done!A genuine #????, at last! Here's something for your troubles. Heh-heh.

1�You can add a support job to your main one wherever you can change jobs. Of course, it has to be a job you've already acquired.

1�But whatever you choose as your support job, its effective level will never exceed half that of your main one. Your support job won't benefit from any experience points you gain, either. It is, after all, only meant to be supplemental.

1�Let me give you an example: Let's say you've achieved level 20 as a warrior and level 10 as a white mage. If you choose warrior as your main job and white mage as your support job, the following will occur...
1�Your warrior level stays the same at 20, and your effective level in white mage also stays at 10--half the level of your main job. In this case, both jobs function to the fullest in their roles.
1�Now, say you choose the same white mage job as your main one and put your warrior job as your support job...
1�Your white mage level is still 10, but the effective level of your warrior job drops to 5, half the level of your main job. Now, that's a lot of wasted potential, isn't it? Hoh-hoh.

1�And selecting a job with a level less than half of your main one as your support job isn't going to do you much good, either. Make sure you're using your jobs to their fullest when choosing support jobs.
1�As to which job is best suited to your main job...ideally, it should be one that either covers your main job's weaknesses, or one that enhances its strengths.
